basics.name: Bradley Rosenfeld
basics.label: Web Security Analyst
basics.summary: I am a developer who is passionate about information security. My objective is to work for an organization that wants to solve new security problems.

awards.title: Outstanding Peformance 2015 NSA CyberSpring Competition
awards.summary: Placed top 30 out of 160+ competitors in a live CTF competition.

awards.title: 1st Place BVU CTF 2015
awards.summary: Worked with 3 other Taylor students in a live CTF competition involving attack/defense of 5 different services.

skills.name: Networking
keywords: TCP/IP, DNS, SSH, HTTP, TLS, socket programming

highlights: Responsible for front-end development on client marketing sites. Worked with team to execute project roadmaps.
Built custom e-commerce platform on top of WordPress. Focused on application security from the front-end to the back-end
Configured development build pipeline on multiple platforms. Set up automatic production deployments. Configured AWS installations.
In charge of front-end development. Converted static Photoshop designs into flexible layouts
Integrated static templates with WordPress and Joomla templating systems
Developed JavaScript for site interactions and API integrations
Advised on responsive design best practices. Developed and wrote documentation for an internal responsive web design framework.
Developed several mobile themes for a custom content management system
Crafted a jQuery mobile theme for use on a client marketing website
